page.title: 11Traffic Problems, Isfield
page.content: This quiet village is being used as an{unofficial bypass}by people avoid- ing traffic jams in Uckfield. When Uckfield Bypass is completed only {10_20% less traffic}is expected. Most cars travel fast even on the sharp bends. Parts of the road do not have footpaths;{children}and the{elderly are particularly at risk. The{Parish Council}have tried to get something done for the past six years. They have pushed for a 30 m.p.h.{Speed {Limit}through the village but have met with little success. Other suggestions were to have double white lines & 'Go Slow' signs. Although the County Coun- cil will not allow these on their land residents have put up signs on their own property. The Council have erected 'Acute Diversion Chevrons' but it is felt that there will be more{accidents before the cars are made to slow down.
